meanings.definition: Sharpness or keenness of thought, vision, or hearing.
meanings.sent1: Her acuity in solving puzzles impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The detective's acuity in noticing small details helped solve the case.
meanings.sent3: His acuity in finding the hidden treasure made him the hero of the town.
meanings.sent4: The acuity of the hawk's vision allowed it to spot its prey from great distances.
meanings.sent5: The acuity of her memory was so sharp that she could recall every detail of the event.

meanings.definition: The ability to think clearly and make good decisions.
meanings.sent1: With his acuity, he was able to navigate through the complex problem easily.
meanings.sent2: Her acuity in decision-making led the team to success.
meanings.sent3: The robot's acuity in choosing the right path amused the scientists.
meanings.sent4: His acuity in strategy was like that of a master chess player.
meanings.sent5: The acuity of her judgment was evident in her wise choices.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to see or hear clearly.
meanings.sent1: The glasses improved her acuity, allowing her to read small print.
meanings.sent2: His acuity in hearing even the faintest sounds saved him from danger.
meanings.sent3: The cat's acuity in spotting mice made it the best hunter in the barn.
meanings.sent4: The acuity of the telescope revealed distant stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The acuity of his vision made the beautiful landscape even more breathtaking.
